bug.author: rasbt
bug.summary: [JOSS] Documentation typo in Adaboost code example
bug.description:
In the Python Bindings docs of Adaboost (<denchmark-link:http://www.mlpack.org/docs/mlpack-3.0.1/python/adaboost.html>http://www.mlpack.org/docs/mlpack-3.0.1/python/adaboost.html</denchmark-link> ), the following code example is provided: <denchmark-code>>>> adaboost(training=data, weak_learner='perceptron') >>> model = output['output'] </denchmark-code>
I believe this should be <denchmark-code>>>> adaboost(training=data, weak_learner='perceptron') >>> model = output['output_model'] </denchmark-code>
based on the description at the very bottom: (output_model (mlpack.AdaBoostModelType): Output trained AdaBoost model.)?

comments.comment:
One more issue related to that: Shouldn't the output be assigned to a variable output in the first line to make the second line work? I.e., <denchmark-code>>>> output = adaboost(training=data, weak_learner='perceptron') >>> model = output['output_model'] </denchmark-code>
As far as I can tell, this issue is also present in the other examples (e.g,. perceptron, etc.)

You're right about the lack of output =, this is a bug in the auto-generated documentation. It always helps to have an extra set of eyes---thank you for pointing this out. The output -> output_model is a specific error in the AdaBoost code.

It always helps to have an extra set of eyes
I agree :). Coincidentally, not too long ago, I submitted a ML toolkit library to JOSS as well (mlxtend) and was bumping into similar issues with the autogenerated docs that the reviewer found
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/1421>#1421</denchmark-link> is merged, so I will close this now.
